article.title: Researchers spotted a zero-day exploit kit abusing CVE-2025-9911 in SSL-VPN gateways
article.body: Researchers spotted an active zero-day exploit kit abusing CVE-2025-9911 in several SSL-VPN gateways. Administrators are urged to apply interim mitigations.

article.title: AWS is triaging a sev-1 outage in eu-south-1 affecting S3 and SNS
article.body: AWS reports a sev-1 outage in eu-south-1, impacting S3 and SNS APIs. Engineers are rolling back a faulty networking update.

article.title: Okta confirms a breach exposing 73 K session tokens; password resets underway
article.body: Okta acknowledged that threat actors exfiltrated 73 000 session tokens via a compromised support account. The company has forced global password resets.

article.title: Google Cloud investigating high-severity vuln (CVE-2025-1024) enabling container escape
article.body: Google Cloud engineers are validating reports of CVE-2025-1024, a container-escape flaw in GKE Autopilot. A patch is expected within 12 h.

article.title: Microsoft detects mass exploitation of CVE-2025-8409 against Exchange Online
article.body: Microsoft warns that CVE-2025-8409, a post-auth RCE in Exchange Online, is being mass-exploited. Defender ATP detections have been updated.

article.title: Fortinet ships emergency patch for CVE-2025-9977 allowing admin bypass in FortiOS
article.body: Fortinet issued a hotfix for CVE-2025-9977 after proof-of-concept code surfaced on GitHub. Users should update immediately.

article.title: Elastic investigates data exfiltration via misconfigured snapshot repository
article.body: Elastic Cloud Engineering is examining reports that a misconfigured snapshot repo leaked sensitive indices to the public internet.

article.title: Zoom confirms zero-day (CVE-2025-9188) in macOS client exploited in-the-wild
article.body: Zoom pushed version 7.2.11 to address CVE-2025-9188, a code-execution flaw already exploited in targeted attacks against macOS users.

article.title: Cloudflare mitigates large-scale DDoS peaking at 158 M rps against HTTP/2 endpoints
article.body: Cloudflare automatically mitigated a record-breaking DDoS surge that peaked at 158 million requests per second targeting HTTP/2 endpoints.

article.title: Atlassian warns of malicious app impersonating Confluence Questions on Marketplace
article.body: Atlassian Security removed a malicious app posing as ‘Confluence Questions’ that installed a backdoor on self-managed servers.

article.title: Netflix introduces retro 8-bit theme in its TV app
article.body: Netflix’s latest update adds an optional retro 8-bit UI theme for nostalgic viewers. No security changes were included.

article.title: Apple showcases translucent MacBook concept at WWDC
article.body: Apple’s design team unveiled a translucent MacBook prototype, emphasizing sustainability and recyclability.

article.title: Steam adds collectible profile frames for summer sale
article.body: Valve’s Steam platform now lets users equip animated frames around profile avatars during the 2025 summer sale event.

article.title: Slack introduces ‘focus mode’ with automatic status updates
article.body: Slack’s new focus mode dims channels and automatically sets Do-Not-Disturb status for preset intervals.

article.title: IBM Cloud launches dark-mode dashboard theme
article.body: IBM Cloud’s console now supports a system-wide dark mode, improving accessibility for low-light environments.

article.title: Google Cloud debuts AI-assisted architecture diagrams in DrawIO
article.body: A new integration auto-generates architecture diagrams from Terraform files within Google Cloud’s DrawIO add-on.

article.title: Oracle announces Java 23 preview with pattern-matching tweaks
article.body: At JavaOne, Oracle teased Java 23 featuring record pattern improvements and sequenced collections.

article.title: NVIDIA showcases RTX 6090 with dual-slot liquid cooler at SIGGRAPH
article.body: NVIDIA’s upcoming RTX 6090 GPU features a built-in dual-slot liquid cooling solution, aimed at AI workstations.

article.title: Zoom rolls out 3-D avatars for informal meetings
article.body: Zoom’s new 3-D avatar feature lets participants appear as customizable characters during casual calls.

article.title: DigitalOcean adds cost-estimator widget to billing console
article.body: DigitalOcean’s new billing widget projects monthly spend based on active droplets and bandwidth usage.

article.title: Citrix patches CVE-2025-7721 allowing unauthenticated RCE in NetScaler ADC
article.body: Citrix released firmware 14.2-37.32 that fixes CVE-2025-7721, an unauthenticated RCE actively exploited against internet-facing ADC appliances.

article.title: VMware ESXi servers hit by new ransomware strain ‘HyperLock’
article.body: Mandiant researchers report HyperLock encrypts ESXi datastores via CVE-2025-8484; no decryptor is available.

article.title: AWS adds dark-mode toggle to IAM console
article.body: AWS today introduced a dark-mode theme for the IAM console to reduce eye strain. No functional changes were included.

article.title: Okta outage in APAC blocks SSO logins for two hours
article.body: Okta blamed the incident on a faulty database schema change; services restored after rollback.

article.title: Microsoft rolls out Teams emoji skin-tone selector
article.body: The July Teams client adds granular skin-tone selection for reactions. No security fixes.

article.title: CISA adds SonicWall CVE-2025-2879 to KEV catalog; federal agencies must patch by July 20
article.body: CVE-2025-2879 is an auth-bypass flaw in SonicOS. Agencies have five days to comply.

article.title: DigitalOcean schedules NYC3 network maintenance for August 3
article.body: Expected impact is up to 5 minutes of packet loss per droplet during the two-hour window.

article.title: Apple releases watchOS 12 beta with new sleep-tracking ring
article.body: Developers can download watchOS 12 beta 1 today; no security advisories were issued.

article.title: GitHub Actions workflow tokens leaked in public repo
article.body: Security researcher found 12 long-lived workflow tokens hard-coded in an open-source project; GitHub revoked them.

article.title: Oracle Cloud adds ‘quick cron’ UI for scheduled functions
article.body: The new interface lets users pick common cron expressions from a dropdown.

article.title: Red Hat ships urgent kernel fix for CVE-2025-8842 privilege escalation
article.body: RHEL 9.5 users should apply kernel-5.15.0-251 immediately; active exploitation detected.

article.title: IBM QRadar outage prevents log ingestion for EU tenants
article.body: IBM acknowledged ingestion delays of up to three hours for EU-based QRadar Cloud tenants; root cause under investigation.

article.title: Cisco adds rainbow sidebar theme to Webex
article.body: The optional theme can be enabled in preferences; no backend changes were made.

article.title: Cloudflare turns on HTTP/3 by default for free tier
article.body: All zones on the free plan now serve HTTP/3 without manual enablement; no downtime expected.

article.title: Trend Micro reveals PoC for CVE-2025-7843 in Deep Security Manager
article.body: PoC shows unauthenticated SQL injection; patch expected in 48 hours.

article.title: VMware adds drag-and-drop ISO upload in vSphere Client
article.body: Quality-of-life feature only; no functional changes to ESXi.

article.title: Azure AD outage in Germany Central disrupts SAML logins
article.body: Microsoft is reverting a rollout after authentication failures impacted multiple tenants.

article.title: SUSE publishes advisory on glibc DNS spoofing flaw CVE-2025-9101
article.body: OpenSUSE 15.6 users can install glibc-2.39-patch3; no active exploitation reported.

article.title: GitLab adds confetti animation when closing issues
article.body: GitLab 18.7 introduces a celebratory confetti burst when issues are closed; feature can be disabled in user settings.

article.title: Fastly mitigates global BGP route leak that slowed CDN traffic
article.body: Fastly rerouted traffic after a mis-announced prefix caused latency spikes across Europe and Asia.

article.title: Palo Alto Networks fixes PAN-OS path-traversal bug CVE-2025-9971
article.body: Path-traversal can lead to arbitrary file read; update PAN-OS to 11.2.1-h2.

article.title: Atlassian Confluence Cloud adds AI-generated meeting summaries
article.body: The feature drafts action items after pasting Zoom transcripts; currently in beta.

article.title: Qualys discloses CVE-2025-3002 local root on systemd-based distros
article.body: Exploit requires local access; patches available for Ubuntu, Debian, Fedora.

article.title: New Relic adds customizable dark-mode dashboards
article.body: Users can now apply per-dashboard themes; no backend changes were made.

article.title: Snowflake outage in EU-West region causes ETL job failures
article.body: Snowflake engineers traced the incident to a metadata service regression; most workloads recovered within 90 minutes.

article.title: AWS releases CDK 3.0 with resource-graph visualizer
article.body: Developers can now preview a graph of generated CloudFormation stacks before deployment.

article.title: Microsoft 365 outage knocks out SharePoint search worldwide
article.body: Search queries returned HTTP 503 for roughly 40 minutes; caused by faulty index update.

article.title: JetBrains previews AI-powered code review suggestions in YouTrack
article.body: The experimental feature suggests inline improvements using the JetBrains AI Assistant.

article.title: Akamai mitigates record 12-Tbps DDoS aimed at European bank
article.body: Attack leveraged DNS reflection; Akamai routed traffic through scrubbing centers.

article.title: Oracle adds purple theme option to Cloud Console
article.body: The cosmetic update includes a sunset gradient header; no API changes.
